Our comprehensive catalog includes configurations tailored for students, small families, and those seeking premium, full-service residences. Understanding the different needs of tenants is our priority, and we focus on presenting properties that offer maximum value, modern architecture, and high standards of maintenance.

Whether you prioritize proximity to the metro station, need access to specific school zones, or require fully furnished convenience, our platform filters the best Sector 84 rentals based on your criteria. Explore the popular flat types below and understand why this locality is becoming the top choice for discerning renters in Gurugram.

faqSection.title: Common Questions About Renting a Flat in Sector 84 Gurugram Answered
faqSection.description: Get detailed answers to the most frequent queries regarding leasing, maintenance, amenities, and community guidelines specific to securing a Flat For Rent in sector 84.

faqs.question: What is the typical security deposit required for a rental flat in Sector 84 Gurugram
faqs.answer: The standard practice for rental properties in Sector 84 generally involves a security deposit equivalent to two or three months' rent. This deposit is held by the landlord throughout the tenancy period and is refundable upon vacating the premises, provided there are no damages beyond normal wear and tear and all outstanding utility bills are settled. Some premium or fully furnished properties may request a higher deposit, but this is always stipulated clearly in the rental agreement for full transparency before signing.

faqs.question: Are brokerage fees mandatory when securing a Flat For Rent in sector 84
faqs.answer: Brokerage fees are customary in the Gurugram rental market, especially for premium locations like Sector 84. Typically, the fee is equivalent to one month's rent and is payable upon successful finalization of the lease agreement. Working with a reliable, registered broker ensures professional handling of paperwork, background checks, and negotiation between the tenant and the landlord, justifying the service charge for a smooth and legal tenancy process.

faqs.question: What lease terms are standard for residential rentals in Sector 84
faqs.answer: Most residential rentals, including a 2 BHK or 3 BHK Flat For Rent in sector 84, operate on a standard 11-month lease agreement. This duration is beneficial as it avoids stamp duty complexities associated with leases exceeding one year. Leases often include a renewal clause, allowing tenants to extend their stay after the initial period, usually with a pre-agreed escalation in rent, typically between 5% and 10%.

faqs.question: Is parking available for tenants in Sector 84 apartment complexes
faqs.answer: Yes, almost all modern apartment complexes in Sector 84 provide dedicated parking facilities. Most flats come with at least one reserved covered or open parking slot. If you require space for a second vehicle, it is essential to clarify this during the negotiation phase as additional slots may incur an extra monthly fee, subject to availability within the society premises.

faqs.question: What common amenities are included with a Sector 84 rental flat
faqs.answer: Rental flats in Sector 84 are typically situated within self-sufficient residential societies. Standard amenities often include 24/7 security and CCTV coverage, reliable power backup for common areas and potentially for limited points within the flat, piped gas connections, and access to basic society services like maintenance staff and gardeners. Many complexes also feature clubhouses, gyms, and swimming pools.

faqs.question: How close is Sector 84 to the nearest metro station and major transport routes
faqs.answer: Sector 84 enjoys excellent connectivity. While it might require a short drive or an auto-rickshaw ride to the nearest operational metro station on the Violet Line, future plans indicate closer metro expansion. Crucially, the sector offers immediate access to the Gurugram Bypass Road and the NH 44, ensuring swift travel to Delhi, Noida, and Gurugram, minimizing commute times significantly for professionals.

faqs.question: Who is responsible for repairs and maintenance during the tenancy period
faqs.answer: Generally, the responsibility is split. The landlord is typically responsible for major structural repairs, fixture replacements, and issues related to the building structure or external plumbing. The tenant, however, is usually responsible for minor repairs, daily wear and tear maintenance, and timely payment of electricity and water bills. Specific clauses regarding AC servicing and appliance maintenance should be clearly detailed in the lease agreement before occupancy.

faqs.question: Can I negotiate the rent price for a Flat For Rent in sector 84
faqs.answer: Yes, negotiation is often possible, especially if you are committing to a longer lease period or if the property has been vacant for some time. Rental market conditions fluctuate, and our rental experts can provide guidance on realistic negotiation ranges based on current sector demand, the quality of the flat, and whether the apartment is fully furnished or unfurnished. We facilitate fair and constructive negotiation between parties.

faqs.question: Are pets allowed in rental apartments in Sector 84 complexes
faqs.answer: Pet policies vary significantly across different housing societies in Sector 84. Many complexes have specific rules regarding pet size and breed, or may require prior written permission from the RWA and the landlord. When searching for a Flat For Rent in sector 84, it is vital to inform us if you have pets so we can prioritize pet-friendly listings and verify specific society regulations beforehand to avoid issues later.

faqs.question: What documents are required to finalize a rental agreement in Sector 84
faqs.answer: To finalize the agreement, you will typically need several documents including a government-issued photo ID (Aadhar Card, Passport), address proof, and often proof of current employment or income. For foreigners, a valid visa and passport are mandatory. Both the tenant and landlord must provide passport-sized photographs. All documents are required for police verification and registration of the lease deed.
